item.title: Virtual Career Fair - Analytics and Decision Science
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

We’re on a mission to build the relationship-focused bank of the future and we’re looking for the passionate collaborators, innovators, advisors, and leaders who can get us there. Our distinct culture is built on a shared commitment to do what’s right for our clients, our people, and our communities, and we strive for excellence in everything we do. Because life at CIBC is not only what you do, but how you do it.

We would like to connect with candidates pursuing Analytics and Decision Science job opportunities in areas such as:

  • Data and Reporting
  • Decision Science
  • Frontline and Distribution Analytics
  • Optimization
  • Product Analytics
  • Risk Analytics

Career Exploration Event

We’re hosting a virtual career exploration event where you’ll connect with team members, leaders and hiring managers in Analytics and Decision Science who are eager to share their stories with you. At this exclusive event, you’ll have the opportunity to:

  • Learn more about career opportunities
  • Learn about our purpose, culture, and commitment to community
  • Ask our team members questions

Event Details:

  • Date: Wednesday April 13th
  • Presentation and Panel Discussion: 4:30pm-5:30pm EST
  • Q&A : 5:30pm-6:00pm EST
  • Location: Microsoft Teams (access information to follow)
  • By Invitation Only

To register for this event:

  • Click Apply
  • Enter your first name, last name and contact information
  • Upload your resume or input your LinkedIn profile URL
  • Once you have applied, a Talent Acquisition Partner will connect with you to discuss next steps
  • The Wednesday April 13th VCF is an invitation-only event

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

  • CIBC is committed to doing our part to protect our team, our clients and our communities. We want to ensure we have a safe and healthy workplace, and we want to do our part to get through this pandemic. In keeping with this commitment, and as a condition of employment, CIBC requires all successful candidates to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as of their start date, or provide written proof of a medical exemption, or other substantiated accommodation request under applicable human rights legislation.  

Job Location

Toronto-81 Bay, 10th Floor

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

Skills

item.title: Manager, Secured Lending Analytics
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You\'ll Be Doing

The Manager, Secured Lending Analytics will be a leading contributor in the Analytics & Decision Science team supporting Personal and Business Banking. The Analytics & Decision Science team focuses on creating next generation analytics assets to enable data-driven decision making for partners in Product, Marketing, Client Segment and Strategy. In this role, you will lead analytics engagements to evaluate client behaviours and optimize business decisions related to product, campaign, pricing and other business areas. You will present insights and make data-driven recommendations to senior leaders to help identify opportunities to grow the business and better serve our clients.

At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role. You’ll have the flexibility to manage your work activities within a hybrid work arrangement where you’ll spend 1-3 days per week on-site, while other days will be remote. Details on your work arrangement (proportion of on-site and remote work) will be discussed at the time of your interview.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Consultant – You integrate domain knowledge with analytical capabilities to deliver value to stakeholders, enable data-driven decision making and proactively identify opportunities to drive business growth (projects/business cases, acquisition/retention campaigns, pricing, channels, segments, products and process enhancements)
  • Analytics – You identify and leverage the right statistical techniques (descriptive, predictive, prescriptive) to extract actionable insights out of client behaviours and business trends (both internal and external).  You appropriately integrate of big data, business intelligence, visualization, self-service and analytical tools into engagements.  You proactively explore new applications of advanced analytics to innovate and build strategic analytics assets.
  • Technology – You leverage big data/analytical tools to analyze large structured and unstructured datasets, build data pipeline and visualization from multiple data sources.
  • Ownership – You think and act like an owner in analytics initiatives ensuring the proper identification and translation of business needs into analytics requirements.
  • Communication – Find the story in data and be flexible in communicating at varying levels of details for the right audience.

Who You Are

  • You have a degree in a quantitative field (i.e. mathematics, statistics, computer science, economics, engineering, physics, business) or equivalent experience. Advanced degree is an asset (i.e. MMA, MBAN, MSc, MA, MBA).
  • You are a problem solver. You have exceptional critical thinking, problem solving and decision making skills with demonstrated ability to independently identify and analyze business problems and recommend solutions.
  • You are proficient in programming languages and have experience using modern big data, analytical and dashboard tools (i.e. SAS, SQL, Python, Alteryx, Tableau).
  • You have experience in building end-to-end analytics solutions involving large datasets (i.e. requirement gathering, data extraction, cleaning and transformation, statistical analysis, presentation & implementation).
  • You are an avid learner who recognizes the analytics field is constantly evolving. You seek to explore emerging trends and best practices in the industry and are excited to share the knowledge with others.
  • You can be clearly understood. You have very strong communication and presentation skills with a demonstrated ability to clearly and concisely present information to groups and individuals at all levels in the organization.
  • You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it\'s the right thing to do.
  • Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard.
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, your goals are a priority. We start with your strengths and ambitions as an employee and strive to create opportunities to tap into your potential. We aspire to give you a career, rather than just a paycheck.

  • We work to recognize you in meaningful, personalized ways including a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, a health benefits program, defined benefit pension plan, an employee share purchase plan and MomentMakers, our social, points-based recognition program.
  • Our spaces and technological toolkit will make it simple to bring together great minds to create innovative solutions that make a difference for our clients.
  • We cultivate a culture where you can express your ambition through initiatives like Purpose Day; a paid day off dedicated for you to use to invest in your growth and development.

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

  • CIBC is committed to doing our part to protect our team, our clients and our communities. We want to ensure we have a safe and healthy workplace, and we want to do our part to get through this pandemic. In keeping with this commitment, and as a condition of employment, CIBC requires all successful candidates to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as of their start date, or provide written proof of a medical exemption, or other substantiated accommodation request under applicable human rights legislation.  

Job Location

Toronto-81 Bay, 25th Floor

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

Skills

item.title: Sr. Consultant , BI Analytics
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

The Senior Consultant, BI  Analytics reporting to the Director, BI and Strategy, Analytics and Decision Science and will be accountable for the day-to-day and strategic opportunities that align with the Personal and Business Banking Strategy. The Analytics & Decision Science team focuses on creating next generation analytics assets to enable data-driven decision making for partners in Product, Marketing, Client Segment and Strategy. In this role, you will lead the delivery of data driven insights and solutions to evaluate client behaviors and to optimize business decisions related to product, campaign, pricing and other business areas.   

At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role. You’ll have the flexibility to manage your work activities within a hybrid work arrangement where you’ll spend 1-3 days per week on-site, while other days will be remote. Details on your work arrangement (proportion of on-site and remote work) will be discussed at the time of your interview

How You’ll Succeed

  • Innovative Problem Solving – Actively lead the development, delivery, and continuous improvement of complex data analytics and visualization solutions. Focus on quality, depth of analysis, and clear communication of actionable recommendations.
  • Business Effectiveness - Identify and recommend changes that enhance operations whether through technology or other processes to ensure the efficiency and effectiveness of the department.
  • Strategic Thinking Approach – Drive, manage and execute PBB data and reporting projects and initiatives in alignment with CIBC and PBB Strategy while supporting the business goals, objectives and KPIs. Ability to think strategically about how to mobilize and engage teams across the enterprise to deliver strategic change.
  • Relationship Management - Manage the relationship between the Data and Reporting and various partners throughout the bank with a high focus on client experience and partnering for shared success.  Build internal and external relationships as required to help ensure we are providing the right level of service to our leadership team and business partners. 
  • Communication -  Excellent verbal and writing skills to effectively articulate ideas and opinions that involve analysis, processes, and technology solutions to others with different disciplinary backgrounds. Ability to produce a variety of business documents that demonstrate command of language, clarity of thought and orderliness of presentation.
  • Reporting - Track progress and conduct analysis of data and reports. Support in the tracking and communication of performance metrics.
  • Design & Develop: Act as a SME on the analysis of requirements. Lead the design and development of cost-effective and innovative data and reporting solutions to meet business objectives.

Who You Are  

  • You can demonstrate experience in:  Various BI reporting solutions Cognos reports including Cognos Cubes , Tableau , Thoughtspot . ETL development like Alteryx , SAS . Database experience : Oracle , Netezza , Azure SQL . Microsoft Azure is an asset. Microsoft Azure Data Platforms :  Databricks , Synapse and BI tools on Azure
  • Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard.
  • You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information. Understanding internal banking processes and how they translate into data outputs.
  • You act like an owner. You thrive when you\'re empowered to take the lead, go above and beyond, and deliver results.
  • You embrace and champion change. You\'ll continuously evolve your thinking and the way you work in order to deliver your best.
  • Your influence makes an impact. You use your relationships and technical knowledge to influence enterprise projects.
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, your goals are a priority. We start with your strengths and ambitions as an employee and strive to create opportunities to tap into your potential. We aspire to give you a career, rather than just a paycheck.

  • We work to recognize you in meaningful, personalized ways including a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, a health benefits program, defined benefit pension plan, an employee share purchase plan and MomentMakers, our social, points-based recognition program.
  • Our spaces and technological toolkit will make it simple to bring together great minds to create innovative solutions that make a difference for our clients.
  • We cultivate a culture where you can express your ambition through initiatives like Purpose Day; a paid day off dedicated for you to use to invest in your growth and development.

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

  • CIBC is committed to doing our part to protect our team, our clients and our communities. We want to ensure we have a safe and healthy workplace, and we want to do our part to get through this pandemic. In keeping with this commitment, and as a condition of employment, CIBC requires all successful candidates to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as of their start date, or provide written proof of a medical exemption, or other substantiated accommodation request under applicable human rights legislation.

item.title: Director, Payments Analytics
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions so you feel empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and feel truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

What You’ll Be Doing

The Director, Payments Analytics will have accountability for providing expert analytics leadership to our product partners as part of the Analytics & Decision Science team.  In this role, you will lead the analytics agenda for the Payments team, acting as a strategic thought partner, delivering insights, analysis, tools and data-driven recommendations to help identify opportunities to grow the business and better serve our clients.

At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role. You’ll have the flexibility to manage your work activities within a hybrid work arrangement where you’ll spend 1-3 days per week on-site, while other days will be remote. Details on your work arrangement (proportion of on-site and remote work) will be discussed at the time of your interview.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Analytics Consulting Leadership – Establish an industry-leading expert Payments analytics consulting team.  Develop strong trusted advisor relationships with Payments partners through impactful engagements.  Integrate deep domain knowledge with analytical capabilities to deliver value to stakeholders, enable data-driven decision making and proactively identify opportunities to drive business growth (projects/business cases, acquisition/retention campaigns, pricing, channels, segments, products and process enhancements).  
  • Analytics Delivery & Innovation – Lead the identification and deployment of analytics and statistical techniques (descriptive, predictive, prescriptive) to extract actionable insights out of client behaviours and business trends (both internal and external).  Lead the integration of big data, business intelligence, visualization, self-service and analytical tools into the everyday toolkit of the team.  Champion the exploration and integration of new analytics tools and techniques to innovate, build strategic analytics assets and drive efficiency.
  • Partner for Success – Own key relationships across our business and with external partners to facilitate our analytics delivery model.  This includes, but is not limited to internal partners in Analytics, Product, Channel, Technology, Risk, Marketing and Finance as well as external Channel, Bureau and Benchmarking partners. 
  • Ownership – Lead the end-to-end orchestration of internal and external partner engagement to ensure the delivery of solutions the meet stakeholder requirements and contribute to business success.  Think and act like an owner by engaging and integrating the right resources to efficiently deliver on business needs.
  • People Management/ Leadership – Create and sustain a high performing, inspired workplace that is consistent with the values of CIBC.  Be a champion of team coaching models, recognize great work, manage career and succession planning and attract/develop top talent to fill key roles in the team in support of our evolving business.

Who You Are

  • You have well-developed leadership skills with proven ability to lead in a fast paced, ambiguous, multi-dimensional matrix environment and to effectively manage multiple activities with varying complexity while under tight time frames
  • You have strong knowledge of banking and retail lending to enable insightful analysis and interpretation of performance and emerging trends
  • You are a problem solver. You have exceptional critical thinking, problem solving and decision making skills with demonstrated ability to independently identify and analyze business problems strategically and recommend creative solutions.
  • You have well-developed communication skills. Written and verbal skills to convey technical information in understandable terms as well as convey thoughts and ideas clearly and in a compelling influential manner
  • You are passionate about people. You find meaning in relationships, and surround yourself with a diverse network of partners. You build trust through respect and authenticity. You have relationship management skills to effectively deal with individuals at all levels of the organization and convey factual and/or conceptual information requiring detailed explanation and interpretation
  • You are driven by collective success. You know that collaboration can transform a good idea into a great one. You understand the power of an inclusive team that enjoys working together to bring a shared vision to life.
  • You look beyond the moment. You make decisions and take actions that will make a difference today and tomorrow. You proactively seek new opportunities to define what\'s possible.
  • You are an avid learner who recognizes the analytics field is constantly evolving. You seek to explore emerging trends and best practices in the industry and are excited to share the knowledge with others.
  • You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it\'s the right thing to do.
  • Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard.
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.
  • You have a degree in a quantitative field (i.e. mathematics, statistics, computer science, economics, engineering, physics, business) or equivalent experience. Advanced degree is an asset (i.e. MMA, MBAN, MSc, MA, MBA, CA, CMA). 
  • You have working knowledge of analytical and data visualization tools. Any combination of SAS, SQL, Python, R, Tableau, Power BI, Cognos, Alteryx, and have the ability to provide guidance to the team on tool deployment and utilization.
  • You have working knowledge of statistical techniques (i.e. regression, time-series analysis, clustering, decision trees).

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • We work to recognize you in meaningful, personalized ways including a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, a health benefits program, defined benefit pension plan, an employee share purchase plan and MomentMakers, our social, points-based recognition program.
  • Our spaces and technological toolkit will make it simple to bring together great minds to create innovative solutions that make a difference for our clients.
  • We cultivate a culture where you can express your ambition through initiatives like Purpose Day; a paid day off dedicated for you to use to invest in your growth and development

What You Need to Know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work in Canada at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit
  • This is a regular full time role with a schedule of 37.5 hours each week.
  • Job location is 33 Yonge Street, 7th floor, however, this may change dependent on business need.

item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

Job Description

Manager, Business Banking Analytics

We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions so you feel empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and feel truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

What You’ll Be Doing

The Manager, Business Banking Analytics will be a leading contributor in the Distribution Analytics team within the Analytics & Decision Science team supporting Personal and Business Banking. The Analytics & Decision Science team focuses on creating next generation analytics assets to enable data-driven decision making for partners in Product, Marketing, Client Segment, Frontline and Strategy. You\'ll lead the design and delivery of insightful and actionable analytics and visualization solutions using data sources across Personal & Business Banking (PBB), and provide operational and tactical support in managing the data analytics environment in support of Frontline and Distribution Analytics strategy. You will present insights and make data-driven recommendations to senior leaders to help identify opportunities to grow the business and better serve our clients.

At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role. You’ll have the flexibility to manage your work activities within a hybrid work arrangement where you’ll spend 1-3 days per week on-site, while other days will be remote. Details on your work arrangement (proportion of on-site and remote work) will be discussed at the time of your interview.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Telling a story from data – You have a passion for understanding the story behind the numbers. You possess exceptional business partnering skills and the ability to communicate business insights easily and effectively
  • Analytics & Reporting – Lead the delivery of streamlined dashboards to influence decisions and/or identify gaps. You have the willingness to take ownership, get your hands dirty and surface insights that are clear and concise for a diverse set of business stakeholders
  • Consultation – Participate as a thought partner and provide advice and recommendations that assist in the development and evolution of our business mandate and help our business make better decisions faster
  • Ad Hoc Analyses – Develop ad hoc analyses to address key business issues as they arise.   Complete complex client and product analyses utilizing a variety of structured and unstructured data sources. Develop and share insights with a wide variety of audiences.
  • Strong Partner – Collaborate and communicate PBB Frontline analytics strategic priorities and act as a liaison with internal and external partners to gather critical information on the various management techniques/client issues/concerns, strategic priorities, business challenges and specific project requirements to support the development of a winning value proposition

Who You Are

  • You have a degree in a quantitative field (i.e. mathematics, statistics, computer science, economics, engineering, physics, business) or equivalent experience. Advanced degree is an asset (i.e. MMA, MBAN, MSc, MA, MBA).
  • You are a problem solver. You have exceptional critical thinking, problem solving and decision making skills with demonstrated ability to independently identify and analyze business problems and recommend solutions.
  • Technical Skills. You are comfortable with working with large datasets and related tools (e.g., SQL Developer, SAS, Python etc.).  You have proven expertise in designing and delivering the user friendly production report for the multiple users using various BI Platform. Strong proficiency in Alteryx and/or Tableau is a must.
  • Analytical. You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems and making sense of information. You\'re confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way.
  • Detail Oriented. You understand that success is in the details. You notice things that others don\'t. Your critical thinking skills help to inform your decision making.
  • You are an avid learner who recognizes the analytics field is constantly evolving. You seek to explore emerging trends and best practices in the industry and are excited to share the knowledge with others.
  • You can be clearly understood. You have very strong communication and presentation skills with a demonstrated ability to clearly and concisely present information to groups and individuals at all levels in the organization.
  • You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it\'s the right thing to do.
  • Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard.
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • We work to recognize you in meaningful, personalized ways including a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, a health benefits program, defined benefit pension plan, an employee share purchase plan and MomentMakers, our social, points-based recognition program.
  • Our spaces and technological toolkit will make it simple to bring together great minds to create innovative solutions that make a difference for our clients.
  • We cultivate a culture where you can express your ambition through initiatives like Purpose Day; a paid day off dedicated for you to use to invest in your growth and development.

What You Need to Know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work in Canada at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

item.description:

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

As a Business Analyst, you will support the Director, Treasury Data Advisory & Solutions to ensure the integrity of captured data in Treasury owned applications. This support will ensure that systems are ready to deliver data on a daily, weekly, monthly and quarterly basis. The role is responsible to ensure seamless end-to-end production as it relates to reporting, reconciliation and load statistics.

Mainly, you will support design, development and change management activities for MR and QRM applications that support Treasury partners for Liquidity Risk management. As a Business Analyst, you will conduct quality testing to identify improvement opportunities and system issues, and will suggest changes / improvements accordingly. You will also ensure all activities are properly documented and in accordance with the enterprise change management guidelines and SLAs.

At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role. You’ll have the flexibility to manage your work activities within a hybrid work arrangement where you’ll spend 1-3 days per week on-site, while other days will be remote.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Participate in enhancements/development - conduct user acceptance testing/quality assurance activities and recommend and assist in the development of new/enhanced reporting systems, policies, procedures and controls to meet regulatory and user requirements, changing circumstances, and deficiencies underlying the current processes. Modify established procedures and approaches to suit specific situations, assist with updating and keeping directories in line with the Record Retention Policy and provide value-added data analysis services to technology and business partners.

  • Handle Internal control environment – maintain adequate documentation, work with internal and/or external auditors when required, help identify and implement areas of improvement within the department, develop and implement sound business processes, practices and technical solutions to address business issues/challenges where applicable under the SOX404 guidelines

  • End-to-End production support - conduct daily review of the operations/exception reports, ensure that operations and systems are performing accurately and on time in accordance with established standards and SLAs. Provide daily and monthly load statistics/variance reports for downstream users\' review. Also work with stakeholders to resolve daily/monthly data loading issues, investigate and resolve various system/data issues, and will initiate projects/processes to resolve recurring operational issues.

item.title: Consultant, Business Intelligence Development
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

Reporting to Senior Manager, BI Development, you will be responsible for development of Contact Centres’ Insights and Analytics solutions, working closely with Business Analysts as well as Technology and Business Partners in a fast-paced Agile environment.   

You will be working with structured and semi-structured data, building relational and multi-dimensional Data Models, Analytics and Reporting Solutions to enable data-driven decision making for partners across CIBC Contact Centres LOBs.  

  • You’ll have the flexibility to manage your work activities within a hybrid work arrangement where you’ll spend 1-3 days per week on-site, while other days will be remote.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Deliver Timely and Accurate Solutions – Design, develop and deliver data models and reporting satisfying user requirements. Ensure data presentation is accurate, intuitive, timely and visually appropriate for broad spectrum of stakeholders audience comprehension. Ensure ease of maintenance and proper access controls.

  • Technology – leverage data and analytical tools to analyze structured and unstructured datasets, build data models, reporting and visualization solutions from multiple data sources.   

  • Establish & Maintain Business Relationships – Develop strong relationships with peers, Business and Technology Partners through meetings, presentations and consulting.

  • Communication – Flexible in communicating at different technical levels for the right audience.

Who You Are

  • You can demonstrate experience in utilizing Business Intelligence & Visualization software applications for 4-5 years to develop data models and reporting (Tableau/Cognos or similar). You can give meaning to data and enjoy making sense of information. You are able to consult business partners to formulate their BI requirements. You have  3-5 years’ experience with RDBMS and  data warehouse and strong SQL skills. It’s an asset if you are familiar with Agile work environment. 

  • You have a degree/diploma in Computer Science or Computer/Software Engineering or equivalent practical work experience in a related field.

  • You embrace and champion change. You continuously evolve your thinking and the way you work to deliver best possible solutions. You seek out innovative solutions and embrace evolving technologies. You can easily adapt to new tools and trends.

item.title: Senior Quantitative Analyst – IFRS 9 & Stress Testing
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

In this role you will work under guidance of the Senior Director, and will be part of a team responsible for the design, development, documentation, and implementation of Stress Testing and Forecasting Models for the Bank’s credit portfolios (retail and wholesale).

How You’ll Succeed

  • Design and Develop - You will contribute to the design, development, documentation, implementation, use, and monitoring of credit stress testing / forecasting models for the Wholesale and Retail portfolios.
  • Use of Models – You will estimate probabilities of default, regulatory capital requirements and potential losses under stress/forecasted scenarios for the Wholesale and Retail portfolios at the bank or business level for the purposes of (i) Internal Capital Adequacy Assessment Process (ICAAP), (ii) regulatory stress testing exercises, (iii) the assessment of risks at the business level, and (iv) IFRS 9 Expected Credit Loss under forward looking information.
  • Analytics – You will work on various ad-hoc credit risk analytics.

Who You Are

  • You have a degree (M.Sc. or Ph.D.) in a quantitative (finance / economics / statistics / mathematics / management science / computer science) field.
  • You demonstrate solid experience in credit risk quantification (PD, LGD and EAD) and time series modeling. Expert knowledge of SAS and its statistical procedures and techniques. Other knowledge of statistical and programing tools an asset.
  • You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information. You\'re confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way.
  • You understand that success is in the details. You notice things that others don\'t. Your critical thinking skills help to inform your decision making.
  • You\'re digitally savvy. You seek out innovative solutions and embrace evolving technologies. You can easily adapt to new tools and trends.
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home
  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity
  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training
  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

item.title: Sr. UX Strategist
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You\'ll Be Doing

You’ll work on the Frontline Technology Strategy User Experience (UX) team which is responsible for conceptualizing and designing UX for employee-facing software applications. You’ll partner with other units across the bank to shape and communicate user experience strategies and design, often serving as the team advisor responsible for defining the overall UX vision throughout the digital ecosystem. You’ll apply an user-centred design approach by using various Research methods while integrating Design Thinking, Strategic Foresight and Analytics in order to fulfill the needs of the Business.  You’ll present recommendations to stakeholders and executives based on data, user feedback and insights collected to support with strategic decision making that support a long-term vision.

At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role. You’ll have the flexibility to manage your work activities within a hybrid work arrangement where you’ll spend 1-3 days per week on-site, while other days will be remote. Details on your work arrangement (proportion of on-site and remote work) will be discussed at the time of your interview.

How You’ll Succeed

  • UX Strategy – You’ll work with stakeholders and other members of the Frontline UX Team to give valuable input and recommendations to key business decisions with an user-centered mindset. You’ll help define an UX Vision and an UX Roadmap for our direct organization using Strategic Foresight. You’ll leverage core themes and findings from UX Research activities and communicate it to the Business for impactful and meaningful short, medium and long-term strategic decisions, while supporting with prioritizing activities and working closely to the Innovation team.
  • Data Analysis – You’ll give meaning to data by connecting design strategy and business metrics. You will look deeply into human behavioral data e how it shifts among time to propose unique but adoptable solutions and approaches to form a robust UX strategy roadmap.
  • Collaborate - You’ll work closely with a multidisciplinary team to develop experiences for our clients and employees. You’ll build strong relationships with stakeholders to help them set a vision for projects, including framing the problems to be solved and defining criteria for project success. You’ll work effectively within constraints, understanding the broader organizational context but also being ready to challenge it when necessary.
  • Research and Present – You’ll promote UX research studies, develop Personas, facilitate discovery sessions, run design thinking workshops, and analyze qualitative and quantitative data. You’ll analyze and translate research data into meaningful insights and powerful stories using artifacts such as customer journey maps, videos and storyboards, executive memos, compelling reports, and townhall presentations that explain unmet needs and present opportunities for change in the future-facing and nearer-term experiences.
  • Teamwork– Promote both user-centred and client-centred designs to project peers in a collaborative way that supports Business Strategy. Establish and build healthy working relations and partnerships with stakeholders, Tech partners, vendors and peers to drive research-led design process.
  • Leadership -  Articulate business value of UX Strategy to stakeholders.

Who You Are

  • You have a minimum of 5+ years of hands-on UX related experience. Team or project Lead experience is an asset.
  • You have a degree/diploma in design and research such as Behavioural Science, Inclusive Design, Data Science, Industrial Design, Business, Information Studies, Cognitive Psychology, Product Design or related fields.

item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

You’ll join our Capital Markets, Total Risk Management Technology group. The Senior Consultant, User Experience is a seasoned expert responsible for driving a digital-first user experience to increase client engagement and achieve business goals. The role uses deep knowledge in their field of expertise to plan and coordinate business tasks and deliverables, running digital design projects with minimal oversight. The Senior Consultant, User Experience analyzes situations and data using in-depth evaluation of intangibles, using human centered design to translate user needs and business requirements into award winning digital experiences. The role exercises considerable judgement for decision making on complex issues, providing art direction, design, and user experience thought leadership to ensure holistic client experiences in terms of usability standards. The role often operates in ambiguous situations and provides innovative, original ideas, accountable to broadly defined policy objectives.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Design - Develop user interface designs for mobile and desktop applications, artefacts, and project deliverables . Develop concept sketches, high fidelity wireframes, graphical assets, prototypes and interactive mock-ups, usability test plans and evaluations
  • Research and Present - Conduct  user research, user interface documentation. Deliver concept and design presentations.
  • Teamwork– Promote both user-centered and client-centered designs to project peers in a collaborative way.

Who You Are

  • You can demonstrate a minimum of 8+ years of UX research experience. As a Lead critical research efforts and conduct complex multi-phase, mixed-method studies that deepen our understanding of the user experience and drive product strategy.
  • Extensive experience in graphic, UI, or UX design with experience in enterprise application and using data-driven analytics
  • Strong technical understanding of and expertise in visual design practice theory / visual design tools; strong working knowledge of visual design methodologies
  • Experience leading a workstream within a project and/or cross-team and synthesizing feedback and input from a variety of teams.
  • Experience with user testing and qualitative usability testing.
  • Experience designing and launching digital products.
  • Work in a highly collaborative fashion as a strategic partner to business leads, product owners, and engineers to define both the long-term strategy and the short-term tactics for our products by grounding these decisions in user needs and insights
  • Prioritize research needs and approaches across multiple work streams to work on the right project, scale, and scope at the right time and ensure impact by delivering actionable insights
    Determine and recommend the most efficient and effective user-centered research approaches (qualitative and quantitative) to solve for business needs, meet agreed-upon objectives, and guide business areas through the appropriate UX process.
  • Lead foundational research activities that explore the problem space, frame the problems to be solved, and gather enough evidence and initial direction to define what to do next.
    Monitor UX project execution, including establishing and tracking UX project metrics and UX product scorecards.
  • Experience in UX research on SaaS solutions.
  • Experience conducting qualitative and quantitative research throughout an Agile development process.
  • Experience with using data analytics to identify UX research course of action a plus.
  • Has comprehensive understanding of visual design theory, research data and best practices to design high complexity visual artifacts and facilitate interaction .
  • Creates complex mock-ups and prototypes to communicate intent, or delivery specifications for development.
  • Creates visual components considering the broader context, to be used in multiple situations, to bring about efficiency and consistency and create delight by using the principles of design in a manner that both engages with the user .Uses dynamic visualizations to support analytic thinking .
  • Ensures visual displays, components, color and type meet the specified accessibility requirements.
  • Using the right research method to understand a user problem, guides team and business on test planning best practices, creates and executes against test plans for IA and Usability tests through both moderated and unmoderated sessions and Leads visual design projects / group tasks.

item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

You’ll join CIBC’s Corporate Centre Technology (CCT), Finance, Human Resources & Corporate Secretary, and Legal Technology (FHRCST) Team. As a Senior Consultant, Business Systems Analyst (BSA), you’ll be leading complex projects to provide solutions aligned to CIBC and CCT’s strategic roadmap. You’ll require to participate in all phases of various new and ongoing projects with focus on ideation and solution requirements in collaboration with a diverse team to build flexible and innovative solutions that deliver a best in classbest-in-class client experience.   

 

As the Senior Consultant - BSA, you are a leader who is excited to solve large complex issues,  youissues, you will be tasked to provide comprehensive recommendations and proposals, in addition to guidance and coaching to other team members. You’ll be participating in writing user stories for Agile projects as well as preparing traditional Waterfall documentation, , providing supporting to QA and AD functions, maintaining training materials for your domain, managing relationships, and communicating with Technology and Business stakeholders.  

At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role. To successfully perform the work, details on your work arrangement (proportion of on-site and remote work) will be discussed at the time of your interview.   

How You’ll Succeed

  • Understanding and Analyzing Business Requirements – Work closely with various business and technology partners to lead the discussion and build client focused and innovative solutions that meet business requirements and are aligned with CIBC’s and CCT’s strategic roadmap. Conduct in depth analysis of processes, functional, reporting or data integration requirements and document and communicate the information. As a Subject Matter Expert (SME) in your domain, provide advice and direction to various stakeholders to ensure that the business requirements are appropriately defined. Prepare and validate Solution Requirement Documents (SRD) packages and obtain required signoffs.

  • Reporting & Analytics – Take ownership of several reports and prepare on an ongoing basis, Lead the delivery of streamlined process, influence decisions and/or identify gaps. Provide technical guidance concerning business implications of application development projects. Gather and analyze information and provide recommendations to address and resolve business issues for a specific business group

  • Partnership & Collaboration - Lead cross-functional work packages. Partner with project managers, technical resources, vendors, and management to ensure accurate execution of projects. 

  • Proven Leadership and Mentorship - Support end-to-end project implementation and be the Subject Matter Expert in Business Analysis. Drive to collaborate and support individuals and cross-functional teams to resolve organizational, operational and process problems and coach junior level team members.

Who You Are
